attributes.alt: Big Chart of Big Ideas for The Voice in Rabbit's House. Animals are nervous after hearing a voice in Rabbit’s house. Chart shows a rabbit, leopard, and rhinoceros trembling in fear when a caterpillar crawls into Rabbit's house. A frog helps caterpillar crawl out.

elements.text: Let’s Create
Tell a Tale
What stories do we like to tell?
The Voice in Rabbit’s House
One day, a small caterpillar was out looking for excitement. She came to Rabbit’s house and had an idea.
Caterpillar crawled into Rabbit’s house.
Rabbit came home. When he opened the door, he heard a loud voice.
“Do not enter. I am The Long Furry One. I have 12 eyes to find you with and 6 legs to chase you with and a hungry mouth that bites!” the voice boomed.
Rabbit trembled in fear.
“What can a little creature like me do in the face of The Long Furry One?” he gasped.
Rabbit ran to Leopard. “There is a monster in my house,” he cried. “Help me!”
Leopard was not afraid. But when she got to Rabbit’s house, she heard the loud voice.
“Do not enter. I am The Long Furry One. I have 12 eyes to find you with and 6 legs to chase you with and a hungry mouth that bites!” the voice boomed.
Leopard trembled in fear.
“Twelve eyes is too many!” she said. “Go get Rhinoceros!”
Rabbit ran to Rhinoceros. “Help me!” he cried. “There is a monster in my house.”
Rhinoceros was not afraid. But when he got to Rabbit’s house, he heard the loud voice.
“Do not enter. I am The Long Furry One. I have 12 eyes to find you with and 6 legs to chase you with and a hungry mouth that bites!” the voice boomed.
Rhinoceros trembled in fear.
“Six legs?” he asked. “That’s even more than I have! Rabbit, there is a real monster in your house. You have to move!”
Just then, a little frog hopped by. Rabbit told Frog all about the monster in his house.
“I can help!” said Frog.
The bigger animals laughed. But Frog put his head inside Rabbit’s house.
“I am The Green Slimy One,” Frog’s voice boomed. “My tongue is almost as long as I am. And I swallow my meals whole! Come out now or I will eat you up!”
Caterpillar crawled out.
“Wait, don’t eat me! I am only a little caterpillar,” she cried.
When the big animals saw that the voice belonged to a tiny caterpillar, they couldn’t help but laugh.
“Thank you, brave Frog!”said Rabbit.
And at last, Rabbit couldgo inside his house.
